title: Preface
body: The first time I met Nova Haynes, I remembered it was raining. Not even proper rain really, just a little drizzle that was almost over as soon as it had started. I remember, we met in the park just a few streets away from my house, the one that the flowers always bloomed in all year around. Where most children in our year group visited often. I remember she wore a bright orange spacesuit complete with the helmet which she had tucked under her arm in an awkward position along with a small brightly coloured telescope that displayed so many constellations I knew I’d never learn them all. Her brown hair cascaded down in knots, I remember. She never liked to brush it, she told me later, ‘too much effort’ she’d laugh tossing the almost dreadlocks off her shoulder. I remember she wore a grin as she leaned against an oak behind her, a lopsided grin that I thought made her look as if she was planning something, which later I realised she was. She often was, planning something, she’d always had that air of mischief around her, even when she was younger her mother told me. Even when she was sick, she’d grin that grin as if she’d poured water over her brother’s head while he was sleeping, but in reality, she hadn’t moved for a week. Even when she was confined to her bed day after day after day, even when she couldn’t do much other than smile, she’d grin that mischievous grin and you could hear someone yelling around the corner, when a cascade of sticky honey spilled onto their heads, pretending as if she’d caused this to happen, but in reality, she’d been confined to bed for almost a year. I always guessed that, that would be her last goodbye, that grin, and in some ways, it was, but in other ways it wasn’t. Really, I knew I remembered the first time I met Nova Haynes because she wasn’t dead.

body:
Professor McGonagall: Is it true that you shouted at Professor Umbridge?

Harry: Yes.

Professor McGonagall: You called her a liar?

Harry: Yes.

Professor Mcgonagall: And you told her He Who Must Not Be Named is back?

Harry: Yes.

Professor McGonagall: Have a biscuit, Potter.

— Order of the Phoenix

summary: The thing about characters greatly resembling one parent, usually father and son, mother and daughter and such, is that...
body:
The thing about characters greatly resembling one parent, usually father and son, mother and daughter and such, is that characters marking the merit of that character in comparison to that parent can take away from the character themselves. Say a mentor only helped them because of their parent, or they wouldn’t be as close if their resemblance isn’t uncanny.

The thing about Harry Potter is that it kinda deconstructs this. We all know he looks like James, and the series shows us why its bad that some characters project onto him - heck its a plot point in Order of the Phoenix where Sirius, whose been cooped up for a long time in the house of his abusive family and is a little mentally unsettled, sees too much of his friend in Harry. Molly reminds him that Harry is not his father, and that isn’t not a good thing that people should see him this way.

Harry’s personality isn’t a carbon copy of his father’s, nor his mothers. He is his own person.

Now let’s look at where this is done very badly - let’s say, the Secret of Nimh sequel. I do take ‘bad movies’ with a grain of salt, but this one actually has a negative message. Timmy is pressured by the reputation of his father. He isn’t allowed to have his own character. The favouritism causes resentment and alienation from his family. Almost any confidence people have in him is because of his father.

A character’s story can be influenced by their parents, but its important for them to have connections and story-arcs outside of their resemblance/connection to them.

Ask yourself, ‘would this character be able to stand on their own without their parents’ influence?’

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

summary: i alone am the answer; i alone will make wrongs right. but in order to root out the cancer, it’s got to be kept from the...
caption:
i alone am the answer;
i alone will make wrongs right.
but in order to root out the cancer,
it’s got to be kept from the sunlight.

we are a riddle era au, set in 1948. the cultural aftershocks of the sacred 28 publication are still being felt, even with overlapping wars threatening both muggle and wizarding britain. gellert grindelwald tears across europe while the charming tom riddle cultivates his own following - with enemies on every front, albus dumbledore’s hand is forced to action.

✂ home / plot / wanted / advertise  ✂

reblog.comment:

i alone will make wrongs right.
but in order to root out the cancer,
it’s got to be kept from the sunlight.

but in order to root out the cancer,
it’s got to be kept from the sunlight.

we are a riddle era au, set in 1948. the cultural aftershocks of the sacred 28 publication are still being felt, even with overlapping wars threatening both muggle and wizarding britain. gellert grindelwald tears across europe while the charming tom riddle cultivates his own following - with enemies on every front, albus dumbledore’s hand is forced to action.

✂ home / plot / wanted / advertise  ✂
trail.content:
i alone am the answer;
i alone will make wrongs right.
but in order to root out the cancer,
it’s got to be kept from the sunlight.

we are a riddle era au, set in 1948. the cultural aftershocks of the sacred 28 publication are still being felt, even with overlapping wars threatening both muggle and wizarding britain. gellert grindelwald tears across europe while the charming tom riddle cultivates his own following - with enemies on every front, albus dumbledore’s hand is forced to action.

title: Rise of the Dark Side
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2zLJPzk

by Kelorus

Harry Potter is a child ignored for his brother, the “boy-who-lived”, Julien Potter. What would’ve happened if Harry met the ghost of his ancestor, Dark Vitiate known as Valkorion. Beware, for the Dark Side is strong! (HPxSW, Dark Harry, Wrong BWL OC)
